lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following tools enables you to write markup directly within JavaScript files in React?

JSXHTMLCSSPHP

Make sure to pick JSX.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use React to create a simple conditional rendering to display different player messages.

Make sure to pick props followed by . and then isGameOver, ?, :.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
How can we render text conditionally in React?

Using embedded expressions with ternary operatorsUsing CSS styles onlyBy exclusively using manual HTML updatesUsing only JavaScript without JSX

Using embedded expressions with ternary operators.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Render a message based on user login status using a ternary operator.

Make sure to pick isLoggedIn, followed by ?, and finally :.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Wrap the elements inside a React fragments.

Make sure to pick < followed by > and then <, /, >.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the benefit of using fragments in React?

They group elements without adding extra nodesThey make the page load fasterThey add default styling to elementsThey automatically convert JSX to HTML

They group elements without adding extra nodes.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a React component that displays Access Granted if the user is an admin.

Make sure to pick return followed by role === "admin" and then ?, :.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
In a React component, what happens if you set a JSX element to null and try to render it?

The element is not rendered on the pageThe element is rendered but hiddenIt throws an errorThe element gets a default value

The element is not rendered on the page.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Examine the following React code snippet. What will be shown when the button is clicked?

A text confirming the found messageA list of options appearsNothing changes, the button gets disabledThe application crashes

A text confirming the found message.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a component displaying a motivational quote only when a button is pressed twice or more.

Make sure to pick clickCount followed by >= and then 2, &&.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use conditional rendering to create a maintenance message for a site.

Make sure to pick { followed by underMaintenance and then ?, :, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
What change should be made in the code to properly render a message when the game is over?

Pass true to the isGameOver propChange {isGameOver} to true === isGameOverRemove the conditional renderingAdd more JSX elements

Pass true to the isGameOver prop.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to conditionally render different user types.

Make sure to pick props followed by . and then isVIP, ?, :.

lessons.title: Lesson #2 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will be displayed if the variable prize is null using the logical AND operator?

No prize awardedundefinedYou have wonAn error

No prize awarded.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the logical AND operator to conditionally render a user greeting in React.

Make sure to type &&.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to create a product list using React Fragments instead of a div element as the wrapper.

Make sure to type </>.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following is valid syntax for a React fragment?

<> and </><React.Frag> and </React.Frag><Fragment> and </Fragment><frag> and </frag>

<> and </>.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a React component where a message is only displayed if a user is logged in using a ternary operator.

Make sure to type ?.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the output when you toggle the following component's state from false to true?

Content is visibleContent is hiddenAn error is thrownNo change occurs

Content is visible.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Consider the below code. What text is displayed after the button is clicked?

Welcome to the siteHelloYou just clicked the buttonNo change occurs

Welcome to the site.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which element will be displayed given the following React code?

The <span> elementThe <p> elementNo content will be displayedIt will display both, <p> and <span> elements

The <span> element.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a simplified online/offline indicator with conditional rendering in React.

Make sure to pick isOnline, followed by "Online".
